title: ChillyMatthew
author: ChillyMatthew
content: Hi guys, I'm curious to see what you have to say about this.So, SBF has been exposed as a fraud. He stole billions. Countless people have been scammed by him. He has not been arrested.Now, on 11/30, Wednesday, he will be allowed to be a guest speaker for the DealBook summit in New York.Am I the only one that thinks there should be outrage? What do you guys think? Will it actually happen?Source:https://tokenist.com/sbf-confirmed-he-will-be-speaking-at-ny-times-dealbook-summit-on-nov-30th/

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: Quote from: ChillyMatthew on November 24, 2022, 01:06:37 PMAm I the only one that thinks there should be outrage? What do you guys think? Will it actually happen?I don't know man....it's as if this guy has no shame in his body at all. It will most likely happen since the organizers seems okay with it.It's probably best to ignore any news about his activities outside the bankruptcy or liquidation for now. Just follow the case and let the prosecution team do their thing. Let him enjoy while he can.

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: Do you think he are gonna attend this event?I think he not stupid at all, while he got a problem he will never show up for something like this. Do Kwon & SBF is already enemy public number.1 because of their stupidity make a lot people losing money.NOT GONNA HAPPEND DUDE, it's not benefit from him. Who are gonna take his word? people don't want to listed him speaking, people want to punch him in the face.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: I really just want to see him behind bars, it seems like the media are trying to treat him softly & not for the criminal that he is. Maybe it’s because he donated lot of money to Biden’s campaign. I dunno, it just feels weird, why isn’t he being questioned by the FBI for his leading role in one of the biggest frauds in the 21st century.

comments.author: TravelMug
comments.body: Haist, they shouldn't let this guy speak in any event, summit or anything. What he did with crypto is really bad, worst than Enron and it's hard to clean up his messed. What the authorities should do right now is just arrest him, do a fair investigation and let him rote in jail just like those scammers and big swindlers that we have before him.And for the NY Times summit, they should be ashamed of themselves for letting a guy like SBF speak on behalf of them. And this might damage their reputation, anything that SBF will touch in the future should be be ashamed and not associate themselves with this criminals.

comments.author: Sarah Azhari
comments.body: Quote from: ChillyMatthew on November 24, 2022, 01:06:37 PMHi guys, I'm curious to see what you have to say about this.Just call the FBI to catch him. Many people still ask for his responsibility, I still not sure he is enough brave to come to public as speaker. when he does that, he looks crazy and being to be mad. That possible when happen, SBF will act like lament full drama, cry and tell the sorry to ask forgive him. He is a politician, he will try to make people pity him very much and try to get love from victim. Please, do not be affected by his acting.

comments.author: worle1bm
comments.body: He still thinks he can cover up his mess by speaking at summit and saying he feel bad for all that happened and he is sorry for all your loss? Bullshit and he's being supported by the government because all of his funding and was showing off that he is very simple man in shorts but he is really a scammer who was trying to gain more funds through users but got busted early so he should be punished for it.

comments.author: el kaka22
comments.body: This will cause trouble for sure, there is no doubt about it. Imagine how many people have lost their money because of this and that means we are talking about a situation where he would not be considered a person who is liked at all, and he could be in danger. Someone who lost all his life savings could end up doing something dangerous.Knowing where he will be is a risky thing, people who are too upset could do something silly because they know exactly where he will be, can even plan it beforehand. So, I would suggest him to cancel this, if he does go through with it, at the very least he would be booed off the stage and worst could be something I don't even want to think about.

comments.author: crzy
comments.body: There’s no case against him as far as I know, that’s why he is still here trying to convince the public about his innocence but I’m sure someone will ask more question and probably SBF will be heavily guarded on this event. I’m thinking where he gets the face to speak in the public again after what happened to FTX, if he is trying to regain the trust of many, it will not be easy for sure.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: How can Sam Bankman-Fried be allowed to speak at the New York Times DealBook Summit? Is the New York Times using this to make it a witch hunt? Or is it the New York Times giving him his opportunity to tell his sorry side of the story? To be twenty-nine years old and be an imposter. He is painting his side of the story for the world to see before he goes to trial. This is where one shouldn’t innocent till proven guilty. He is absolutely a rotten person, living his life to the fullest without any repercussions for his actions. All the destruction he has caused to a lot of people.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: Quote from: Yogee on November 24, 2022, 02:45:30 PMQuote from: ChillyMatthew on November 24, 2022, 01:06:37 PMAm I the only one that thinks there should be outrage? What do you guys think? Will it actually happen?I don't know man....it's as if this guy has no shame in his body at all. It will most likely happen since the organizers seems okay with it.It's probably best to ignore any news about his activities outside the bankruptcy or liquidation for now. Just follow the case and let the prosecution team do their thing. Let him enjoy while he can.He seems like every other democrat to me.We already know that MSM is a democrat party asset just like this clown. They are going to make a victim out of this fraud and tell everybody who lost money that they should forget about it. NYT also must have gotten some of those "donations" from SBF. In the end, they need to protect their investments.They stole people's money and they are now making fun of them.Hopefully everybody who lost money on this was a democrat party supporter. They deserve it.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: Quote from: mich on November 30, 2022, 05:22:13 AMHow can Sam Bankman-Fried be allowed to speak at the New York Times DealBook Summit? Connections.I think it's pay back time to those that he has supported when he's still at the peak. Donating money here and there and to the democrats and that's why he's taking all the benefits right now. People even want him in jail but look, he's free out there having talks and I guess this won't be the last appearance he'll have but there could be more.

comments.author: BitDane
comments.body: Quote from: worle1bm on November 25, 2022, 07:30:14 AMHe still thinks he can cover up his mess by speaking at summit and saying he feel bad for all that happened and he is sorry for all your loss? Bullshit and he's being supported by the government because all of his funding and was showing off that he is very simple man in shorts but he is really a scammer who was trying to gain more funds through users but got busted early so he should be punished for it.Still I think SBF is irrelevant to the reason why the event is held.  SBF is a failure so he has no right to tackle anything about being successful.  He is a made up person.  All his achievement had been exposed as lies. He isn't that wonderkid that articles are talking about.  So yeah, except from his accomplishment of making FTX investors lose money, I think there is nothing excellent he did.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: I have watched him at the New York Times DealBook Summit and I am still wondering how he can answer some question with a smile on the face.  Do we care that he has only 100,000 in his bank account because I do not.  He says customers in America will get their money back not sure if this is true. His appearance in court for a hearing on February 2nd, 2023 is when things will come out I hope.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V8b1hAbbHTg

comments.author: zasad@
comments.body: https://www.reuters.com/legal/bankman-fried-set-enter-not-guilty-plea-ftx-fraud-case-2023-01-03/Sassoon suggested that the government has a deep well of evidence against Bankman-Fried, saying prosecutors will turn over hundreds of thousands of documents in coming weeks to the defense.U.S. District Judge Lewis Kaplan on Tuesday set an Oct. 2 date for trial, which Sassoon said could last four weeks.__What happened? Sem became pregnant, he needs 9 months for childbirth and 1 month for recovery.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Whoever has many influential acquaintances, the laws are not as harsh for him as they are for the rest of us. I can explain this leniency and softening in his direction by the fact that he cooperates with powerful politicians who are involved in his patronage. Perhaps we are talking about patronage for bribes. It is likely that a great deal of dubious money passed through the FTX exchange, or that it was some kind of laundry room for whitewashing illegally obtained funds.

comments.author: Margaretv
comments.body: Quote from: ChillyMatthew on November 24, 2022, 01:06:37 PMHi guys, I'm curious to see what you have to say about this.So, SBF has been exposed as a fraud. He stole billions. Countless people have been scammed by him. He has not been arrested.Now, on 11/30, Wednesday, he will be allowed to be a guest speaker for the DealBook summit in New York.Am I the only one that thinks there should be outrage? What do you guys think? Will it actually happen?Source:https://tokenist.com/sbf-confirmed-he-will-be-speaking-at-ny-times-dealbook-summit-on-nov-30th/He may escape guilt for a while, but in the end he will still pay the price for his shame and mistakes. There are no eternal friends, only eternal interests. For large financial groups and political interest groups, SBF is a tool. In addition to giving speeches, he still thinks more about how to make himself more valuable to be used.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Quote from: Xal0lex on January 09, 2023, 04:04:16 PMWhoever has many influential acquaintances, the laws are not as harsh for him as they are for the rest of us. I can explain this leniency and softening in his direction by the fact that he cooperates with powerful politicians who are involved in his patronage. Perhaps we are talking about patronage for bribes. It is likely that a great deal of dubious money passed through the FTX exchange, or that it was some kind of laundry room for whitewashing illegally obtained funds.Yes, the justice is lenient with the powerful and wealthy individuals. To belong to an influent group is everything a criminal needs to not suffer the consequences for his acts. I think it has been like this since a long time ago, maybe since always. I just had the illusion in a country like USA things worked different, so I could understand why they are the greatest nation of the world. But I was wrong and now I don't have any more illusions. Reality is harsh on us, but better to see the truth than live in an eternal lie. The good side of scandals like the one involving SBF is that we become aware of how dirty the justice system is and how politicians manipulate it at their favour.

comments.author: autumnleaf
comments.body: Since he has a history of defrauding people, I doubt he will actually attend this event in person. Instead, I am confident he will conduct the interview virtually. There will be public outcry if perhaps it is true that he plans to attend.
